programme.title: MEX v JPN - Men's Semifinal | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 07/08/2012 at the Wembley Stadium, London. Mexico booked a spot in the Gold Medal match with a 3 to 1 win over Japan

programme.title: KOR v BRA - Men's Semifinal | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 07/08/2012 at Old Trafford, Manchester. Brazil booked a spot in the Gold Medal Match with a 3:0 win against South Korea

programme.title: China dreams football: The rise of private sports schools
programme.desc: Beijing 2008 gave the Chinese sports industry a massive boost and out came an extraordinarily large football school in Guangdong province.

programme.title: Atletico Madrid's darling is key to Colombia success | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Her parents sacrificed everything to give her a chance to achieve her dream of becoming a professional player. From a farming village in the middle of Colombia to being the best number 10 of her country, Leicy Santos’ story is an amazing journey. She left alone to Bogota at 12 and at 15 years old, she was called into the national team. She participated in Rio 2016 Olympics. After winning the first ever professional women’s championship in 2017 with Santa Fe, in 2019, she was the first ever Colombian Player to be signed for a European team, first Colombian player to score in the Champions League and MVP in 2019/20 for Atletico Madrid. She now targets top 3 at FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023.

programme.title: Brighton keeper from Australia in fourth World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Lydia Williams grew up in an Aboriginal community in the middle of Western Australia. At 11, she moved to Canberra. Her mum who was from the US signed her up for football. The local club that she joined only had one position left in division one: goalkeeper. She lost her father at 15 and put all her efforts into football. She was 16 when she made her debut for Australia and 19 at her first World Cup. Rio 2016 Olympics was a special moment for her since Cathy Freeman had always inspired her. Having competed in three world cups and two Olympic Games, she has now reached 100 caps, no doubt that this home competition will be very special for her.

programme.title: CAN v USA - Women's Semifinal - Football | London 2012 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 06/08/12 at the Old Trafford, Manchester. USA booked a spot in the Gold Medal Match with a 4 to 3 Extra Time win over Canada.

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Rio 2016
programme.desc: Two great football nations, Brazil and Germany, clashed in an epic gold medal final featuring Neymar against twins Lars and Sven Bender.

programme.title: Can an Olympic legend turn around Hout Bay's football team?
programme.desc: Team South Africa Olympic footballing legend Matthew Booth tries to turn around the fortunes of a struggling local football team.

programme.title: How sport climbing star Shauna Coxsey found her sport | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Shauna Coxsey is a sport climbing sensation from the UK. With her motto “find something that makes you happy” she made it to the top and is now ready to step up to represent the sport at the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Bruce Lee first inspired this karate champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Saadi Abbas, a karateka from Pakistan, nearly gave up on his Olympic dream. After learning that the sport would join the Olympics in Tokyo, he jumped back into training despite injuries and a lack of funding. Now, he hopes to follow the example of Seoul 1988 bronze medallist Hussain Shah, who is from the same neighbourhood of Karachi, to qualify for the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Jordyn Barratt found herself through skateboarding | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Growing up in Hawaii, it’s not surprising that Jordyn was a surfer long before she stepped on a skateboard. But her life changed when she entered a skatepark for the first time. She finally felt at home and was able to express herself through her movements on the board. Now that skateboarding is an Olympic sport, she’s ready to represent her community on the biggest stage of all.

programme.title: How Peruvian star Lucca Mesinas fell in love with surfing | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Following his parents’ footsteps, Lucca fell in love with surfing at a young age thanks to long sessions in the water with family and friends. With a surprising competitive streak, Lucca has now qualified for the Tokyo 2020 Games, where surfing will make its Olympic debut.

programme.title: How fun fuels this Para-Taekwondo world champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: When Juan-Diego Garcia entered a dojang for the first time at age five, he knew he found his place. As success came against abled bodied competitors, other kids used to ask, “But he doesn’t have an arm, how did he win?” He always proved to himself and others he can do anything. Now, Mexico’s first-ever world champion in Para-Taekwondo is training harder than ever to represent his country and hometown at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games where the sport will make its debut.

programme.title: Deva Handball Club
programme.desc: Team Sweden Olympic hero Thomas Sivertsson travels to Great Britain to try to turn around the fortunes of a struggling handball team.

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Ryan Millar
programme.desc: USA Volleyball star Ryan Millar describes the surreal atmosphere around his run to the Volleyball gold medal at the Olympic Summer Games Beijing 2008. How tragedy in the volleyball community inspired the team to rally behind its coach on this edition of “My Great Olympic Moments”.

programme.title: HUN v ROC / SWE v FRA - Women's Preliminaries - Handball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This match took place on 29/07/2021 at the Yoyogi National Stadium, Tokyo.

programme.desc: This Preliminary Round Game took place on 29/07/2021 at the Saitama Super Arena, Saitama. Final score ESP 81:71 ARG.

programme.desc: This event took place on 29/07/2021 at the Tokyo Metropolitan Gymnasium, Tokyo. Chen (CHN) claimed the Gold, Sun (CHN) the Silver and Ito (JPN) completed the podium.

programme.title: My Great Olympic Moments with Ryan Millar
programme.desc: USA Volleyball star Ryan Millar describes the surreal atmosphere around his run to the Volleyball gold medal at the Olympic Summer Games Beijing 2008. How tragedy in the volleyball community inspired the team to rally behind its coach on this edition of “My Great Olympic Moments”.

programme.title: Pairs, Lightweight Double Sculls, Single Sculls - Rowing | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 29/07/2021 at the Sea Forest Waterway, Tokyo. It includes the Men's and Women's Pair Finals, the Lightweight Men's and Women's Double Sculls Finals and their Victory Ceremonies as well as the Men's and Womens Single Sculls Finals F/E and D.

programme.title: Semi-Finals & Finals - Day 5 - Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 29/07/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre,Tokyo. It includes the Men's 800m Freestyle, the Men's 200m Breaststroke, the Women's 200m Butterfly, the Men's 100m Freestyle, the Women's 4 x 200m Freestyle Relay Finals and their Victory Ceremonies as well as the Women's 100m Freestyle, Men's 200m Backstroke, Women's 200m Breaststroke and Men's 200m Individual Medley Semifinals. Finke (USA) claimed the Gold in the 800m Freestyle, Stubblety-Cook (AUS) in the Men's 200m Breaststroke, Zhang (CHN) in the Womens 200m Butterfly, Dressel (USA) in the 100m Freestyle an CHN in the 4x200m Freestyle Relay Final.

programme.title: Trap Finals - Shooting | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 29/07/2021 at the Asaka Shooting Range, Tokyo. Rehak Stefecekova (SVK) claimed the Gold in the Women's Trap and Liptak (CZE) in the Men's Trap competiton.
